Posts.Content: I am going forward full force with my idea for the little handbook with practical tips for breast cancer patients. As I had mentioned before, it will have the theme of a journey and the diagnosis will decide which route you will take, it's your ticket. So I was thinking for the title, Destination Survival. What do you think? Ayse
Posts.Title: On a positive note....

Posts.Content: You go girl!!! We will always be on standby you just say the words. BIIIG HUG! Ayse
Posts.Title: laughs a lot's test is ok

Posts.Content: It sure sounds like a nightmare! It's not a pleasant feeling to be treated like a piece of meat. I have encountered nurses who only see a wrist and a vein to be injected with chemo, and seem to overlook the fact that there's scared human being somewhere in there but never to the extent you experienced. I can only shake my head in total disbelief and tell you that I am glad that's behind you. Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Venting after surgery

Posts.Content: but she wouldn't give me her adress!! one tough broad that Meena =) Thanks to all who took part. Ayse
Posts.Title: A big Thank You!!!!

Posts.Content: Meena, we made you smile. That's all that matters. I am glad your liked everything. hahha... you did give me a hard time =) Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: A big Thank You!!!!

Posts.Content: Hope you will make it a very special day!!! Here's to many, many more fabulous birthays!! Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Today is jessiesmom1's Birthday!

Posts.Content: A cancer diagnosis will change your life forever. And it is a very traumatic experience. Take time to process it and decide for yourself how you want to approach this journey. Make a plan, empower yourself. How do you want the next few years of your life to be like? Ask yourself these tough questions and stick to your answers. Remind yourself of your game plan in times you find yourself in a whirlwind of emotions that is part of the journey. This place is a great place to come to when you just need to lean on someone or if you need serious advice. So welcome to the most fabulous club, no one wants to belong to (: Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: twlight zone

Posts.Content: Just eyes ROLLING
Posts.Title: comments

Posts.Content: You are much better at this than me. I think you just spoke out what a lot of us have in mind on some days but you put in words and really well. The only consolation I have is that it is temporary and things will look up again soon. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Because some things aren't suitable for Facebook...

Posts.Content: is like loosing a best friend. I understand your grief and I am very sorry for the pain you and bear are experiencing. Hold on tight to each other. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: My Beautiful Angel died

Posts.Content: is like loosing a best friend. I understand your grief and I am very sorry for the pain you and bear are experiencing. Hold on tight to each other. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: My Beautiful Angel died

Posts.Content: and you will always find a willing ear to listen or a shoulder to lean on to. I owe this lady's more than they will ever know. I did this by my own, no family, no boy friend or husband. But I could always count on my sisters to come through for me. How wonderful of you to donate your hair. It is a good idea to cut your hair and get used to it little by little. It is great that they got it ALL! What is your diagnosis, which stage? Good thing you found us early on your journey. Now you have all these sisters to accompany you and if needed to lean on. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: They say they got it all But..........

Posts.Content: this is always my initial reaction when I see a recurrence post (my least favorite kinda post). So if you were in front of me, I wouldn't say anything but give you a big warm comforting hug. Hugs are funny that way, they pick up where words leave off. The first thing I noticed about you was your name, it was amazing to me, it reflected your wonderful attitude. And somehow you managed to uphold that incredible attitude through it all. If we had our own version of the hall of fame, maybe hall of the brave, you would have my vote. You already know we are here for you, though judging from you calmness and your willingness to fight this fight again, it looks like if anything you will be here for us as an amazing example of grace and courage. Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: your wonderful spirit and caring nature shine through your posts and draw me. I admire you and your ability to keep fighting and to keep posting. I have NOT ONCE read a negative thing in your posts. You are much loved and admired. Ayse
Posts.Title: Update on my reoccurence

Posts.Content: this is always my initial reaction when I see a recurrence post (my least favorite kinda post). So if you were in front of me, I wouldn't say anything but give you a big warm comforting hug. Hugs are funny that way, they pick up where words leave off. The first thing I noticed about you was your name, it was amazing to me, it reflected your wonderful attitude. And somehow you managed to uphold that incredible attitude through it all. If we had our own version of the hall of fame, maybe hall of the brave, you would have my vote. You already know we are here for you, though judging from you calmness and your willingness to fight this fight again, it looks like if anything you will be here for us as an amazing example of grace and courage. Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: your wonderful spirit and caring nature shine through your posts and draw me. I admire you and your ability to keep fighting and to keep posting. I have NOT ONCE read a negative thing in your posts. You are much loved and admired. Ayse
Posts.Title: Update on my reoccurence

Posts.Content: You HAVE to report back to us. Tell us just how many heads did you turn on the way back? Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Going to Look Good Feel Better tonight!

Posts.Content: these feelings. When I first read these posts on this board, I didn't quiet understand why they called themselves warriors and fighters but I learned. It takes a lot of courage and endurance, yes and kleenex to go through what we do. The weight is a big problem for me too. But don't do what I did. At the beginning I refused to buy bigger clothes. I HAD to get back to my size and be able to fit in my clothes again. But I would get so frustrated each time, when nothing fit and I looked awful in my old clothes. So I bought a few outfits, I call them my chunkey-flage and I felt better about myself. So go ahead treat yourself. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Cried my eyes out tonight !!!!

Posts.Content: I am with you on this one 100 % Susan. So grateful for the technology that helped me to stay alive. I keep reminding myself of this, on days when I get frustrated with my medical team. It's bizarre if you think in certain parts of the world, an illness way less serious than cancer can cause a person's death. I love science and am totally fascinated by it. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Discovery and Space Station

Posts.Content: You probably barely got any sleep and tense like a bow. That waiting game can be grueling. I am wishing you tons and tons of luck today and putting my arms around you for a nice big comforting hug! Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Liver catscan results on Monday

Posts.Content: My family is over seas and I have to tell you what helped me most was their emotional support. I would love to have them near but it is not possible. So skype keeps me afloat, we video conference, I saw my brother for the first time in 15 years, it was amazing, I cried. Just let her know you are there for her. Call and check and above all LISTEN. Ayse
Posts.Title: My Sister

Posts.Content: we all wish too =) Great pix, thanks for sharing and inspiring. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: new pix up

Posts.Content: Mama G, you are being put through the wringer here. This is not the news we had all anticipated. But I am wishing you strength and courage to continue your fight. A biiig warm and fuzzy bear hug for you, Ayse
Posts.Title: it's back again....... in my spinal fluid

Posts.Content: but it is important to will your body to recover. I have had chemo throughout this past year and I am now almost done with it. Please don't forget chemo's effects are cumulative and it gets worse towards the end. I know you are tired of being sick and tired. Find escapes- music, books or that season of Sex in the city that you missed. Just get through it the best you can. And come here and ask for needed support, we are always here. It's like an emotinoal seven eleven open 24/7. I wish you much luck with your mastectomy and hope it will go all as planned. This will you also a break from chemo, I know it's exchanging one evil for another but it will still let you recover from the effects of the chemo. Please be prepared for chemo, I don't know if you have someone to take care of you but if not then get your home ready. Prepare meals and put them in easy to open containers. Put some dishes on the counter to use, you will have difficulty reaching. Put out some clothes that open in the front out. I think that is enough for now.... I don't want to bore you -) Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Need to vent...I am so..

Posts.Content: What an intricate and beautiful posting. It's funny so many times I feel a certain way, and it is too new or to scary for me to put into words. Then I come here and read the postings and it all falls into place. They open my eyes and put my thoughts into words like I never could, at least not yet. That's why I keep coming back. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: "Somewhere" is A Place We Call Our Second Home, Thank you so much

Posts.Content: Now why would you not share this with us??? I had no idea. You must have been so on the edge. But good news at last, I am letting out a huge sigh of relief. BIIIIG Hug, Ayse
Posts.Title: Some 'HAPPY' news -- Just want to share with all of you -- thru the good times, and bad

Posts.Content: the way you take pleasure in life. I have never seen geese before and never knew why they fly in a V shape. I love it. It is very much like this here on the board, in times like this, we too need a few to strong ones to lead us through the storm. And I think they all know who they are. Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: It's morning here, and the skies are filled with geese....

Posts.Content: Vicki Sam, congrats on your new set of twins!!! I hope you love them. Now you have to go show them world! And vice versa. Ayse
Posts.Title: Vicki Sam is home, resting and recovering -- Not too bad // Exchange went well this morning at 7:30, home by 1 p.m.

Posts.Content: my heart goes out to you, you are such an amazing person. Your writings so eloquent and full of compassion and inspiration. Even during you darkest hour. All I can add is that you have my tears, my frustration, compassion but above all my admiration for the way you handle it all. Hope is what remains. And I am holding on, with ALL I got dear Linda. Sending you lotsa love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Next step in my journey

Posts.Content: Yeah, WHERE is Kathi? You are like our very own Waldo. Would love to hear what you are up to now. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: It's Dutch St. Nicholas day today!!!!

Posts.Content: I know it must breaking into thousand pieces but if you ask me, it's DEFINITELY his loss!!! You are such a sweet, caring and witty Lady. He'll be searching for some time to find the likes of you. So you hold you head up high and don't let him hurt you. YOU are our precious sister and we love you too much to see you get hurt. I am giving you a HUUUUUGE HUG! Ayse PS: Would you like me to punch his lights out (;
Posts.Title: husband signed up to online dating

Posts.Content: mine is easy to remember 9/9. And I looove chocolate. Ice cream too but it tastes best some where in the sun with legs dangling off something. I don't know why. Ayse
Posts.Title: When is your Birthday?

Posts.Content: I know it must breaking into thousand pieces but if you ask me, it's DEFINITELY his loss!!! You are such a sweet, caring and witty Lady. He'll be searching for some time to find the likes of you. So you hold you head up high and don't let him hurt you. YOU are our precious sister and we love you too much to see you get hurt. Posts.Content: mine is easy to remember 9/9. And I looove chocolate. Ice cream too but it tastes best some where in the sun with legs dangling off something. I don't know why. Ayse
Posts.Title: When is your Birthday?

Posts.Content: It breaks my heart to see a family put through the wringer like that. You are a truly amazing family. It must be gut wrenching for you to see your wife and children suffer like that. But I want you to know how impressed I am with your love and loyalty towards your wife. I just know she will fight with all that she has to hold on. And what can you ask more of her? Please hang in there and know that you are doing all you can possibly do. Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: DOES IT EVER STOP????

Posts.Content: These are the rules on this board (: Share, share, share when it comes to troubles, they get lighter that way. And you must admit, some of these posts made you smile.. am I right? I KNEW it, so it looks like we're here listening and caring, no matter what. Wishing you strength and endurance in the upcoming days!! And remember, what you are going through is not "routine"!! I know load of people who would shake in their shoes just imaging going through it. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: finding things a little difficult - acupuncture update

Posts.Content: You have a very special place on this board. You are captain who mapped this unchartered world for us. I will never forget reading Hogwarts for the first time and I knew I had found a special bunch of people. It goes without saying how much we love you and need you. LOTSA and lots of love, Ayse
Posts.Title: My Message to Chenhart

Posts.Content: great news!!! You hold on to Ned and don't you let go. Lotsa love, Ayse
Posts.Title: No Colon Cancer,Thank you Jesus

Posts.Content: I want in on this, I am giving you ALL a huge hug and a little squeeze! Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: GROUP HUG time!

Posts.Content: I am a chicken when it comes to tattoos. I like them on other people though, I must admit. You think you can post a picture of your gorgeous self? I would love to see it. It's so important to feel good about yourself, so good for you! And I can't think of better Birthday present. HAPPY BIRTHDAY my fair lady! Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Permanent makeup - a vanity issue

Posts.Content: but we are all on it with you. As time progresses, you are going to find so much support and information on this board, you are not alone. Once the initial shock settles in, you will get a crash course in cancer and a game plan for your treatment. This will all help ease the anxiety and shift your focus from fear to healing. Arm yourself with as much information as you can, I found it is easier if you take an active role in your treatment. You will be surprised to see just how many women are battling alongside of you. I am glad you found this board it played a big role in my healing process. Feel free to come here anytime with questions, concerns or thoughts you may have. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: new diagnosis....

Posts.Content: I find myself at a loss for words. Sometimes words just aren't enough. And some are more powerful than we can fathom. For me it is the word 'hope'. Hugs Ayse
Posts.Title: Stage 4 and recent MRI scan not good.....

Posts.Content: I am so sorry. It is so hard to put down an animal. I had to do it with one of my rescue cats, he had a nasty disease called stomatitis, basically your gums are allergic to your teeth, he could not eat poor thing would just cry. I had all his teeth pulled, it did not help. And he was suffering, it was one of the hardest things I have done but I knew it was time and I had to do it. 9 years is a long time for that furry little stinker to grow on you, so I can only imagine how hard it must be for you. My friend's cat had cancer and it didn't want to eat my friend made her it and she did. Later the vet found cancer in her mouth as well. And he said that the cat must be in great pain and it is still eating nevertheless to please my friend.. that's how animals are selfless. I know you'll do the right thing. Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: my dog has cancer

Posts.Content: I went to see my Oncle today.. hihi, he laughs when I call him that. Difficulty breathing AGAIN... it was bad this week. BUT it is not the C word. And that is all I needed to hear, what a relief. I will see a Pulmonary specialist on Monday, bye bye cancer - HELLO inhaler! I sure was nervous... been noshing on chocolate the whole week lol. I was so tired, I just could not get a full breath, so out came the comfort foods! Hope everyone has a good weekend!! Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: YeAAAAH Asthma Babey!!!

Posts.Content: I am sighing a big huuuge sigh of relief (: Thank you so VERY much for your caring posts and all your good vibes. Do you know I didn't tell anyone about this but you ladies? This is how close I feel to you. It was a rough week but I kept reminding myself as of today I have nothing to worry about. I hope my post will be fore runner for all the other positive results to come. I am thinking of my dear missrenee, laughs-a-lot and all the other sisters who are on the least favorable of places "the waiting room'. Sending you all hugs and kisses!! Ayse
Posts.Title: Can I get a HALLELUJAH???

Posts.Content: I am so happy that you got accepted. I am keeping my fingers crossed and hoping ferociously that this chemo will kick you cancer's butt! Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Wish me luck! Here I go with the new chemo drug!

Posts.Content: I know this shook you up and I hope that you can find comfort and strength with your family and your meditations. I sure will miss you. But I know you will come back after all we are now sisters. Maybe I joined this club not by choice but meeting and getting to know you, was a very good choice. Sending you my Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: I have to escape for a while

Posts.Content: some doctors can be so insensitive, my PS is a perfect example for that. He made me feel like I am a wuss when only after a week of my mastectomy, I asked for more painkillers. If he wasn't a genius of a surgeon I would go somewhere else too. But now I just ignore his command and behavior. Please don't let it get to you. Most people totally underestimate what it means to have cancer. Honestly, including MYSELF! I seem to think constantly, ok I am better now and set myself back with too much activities and chores. If I myself underestimate this beast how can I blame others for doing the same thing? You just keep up the good work and take care of yourself, don't let her belittle your efforts!!! Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: my first plastic surgeon visit not good

Posts.Content: I am wishing you ALL the luck in the world and hoping this will do away wit the pain. I am hoping for the best for you and keeping you in my thoughts. I will be on the look out for your next filled with good news! Lots of hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Update BJmom

Posts.Content: True to your nature you are accepting your new situation with such grace and courage. Isn't it amazing what life throws at you at times? I am so sorry to hear about this but you know maybe all you need is a little time apart, and who knows. Matters of the heart are so complicated and can be oh so painful at times. At least for me, I am definitely one of those people that leads with her heart. Often times I wonder, just how much our hearts really effect the course of our lives. Stay strong dear heart and when your heart aches come and talk to us. Much love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Off topic....may be my last dutch treat....sigh....

Posts.Content: Jean my heartfelt condolences. Hugs Ayse
Posts.Title: MIL Passed Away

Posts.Content: Marsha, so happy they put a smile on your face. I can relate to the hungry kitties and being a slave to them, LOL But just know I was only the executor of the members of this board who wanted to send you some cheer. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: thank you so much!

Posts.Content: Best wished on your very special day, may this year bring you lots of joy and laughter Ayse
Posts.Title: Today is Cheryl4's Birthday!

Posts.Content: Dianne I am so happy for you!!! No one will "access" you anymore. Those were the worst words ever mentioned to me, "I am going to access you now" eeeeEEEAaaaakkks (hair standing straight up) You have passed another Landmark. I hope you celebrate,celebrate,celebrate!!! Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Thanks to all my Pink Warriors

Posts.Content: I am loving this board today. keep the good news coming. So happy for you!!! We are doing a mass happy dance today   Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: I am so happy...

Posts.Content: Dear Hamish, you will be afraid many times throughout this I found but please try not to let the fear rule you. I am really learning to live in the now and not to let what maybe the outcome worry me so much. Of course I have my days but it helps to remind yourself that they will pass. Talk to your doctor about your concern and until then don't let your imagination run away with you. At least not in this direction. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Feeling scared again!

Posts.Content: and feel the love and concern we have for you on this board. I miss you and am very concerned about you. You probably need time to process the news you just received. But please understand we kindred spirits are thick as thieves and when one hurts we all feel it. Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: I've been thinking about you Heidi - Please post when you can.

Posts.Content: so sorry you had to join us all but glad you don't have to go it alone. I learned more from this site than from all my doctors combined. So hold to us and come for support, advise and hugs whenever you need to. The time after the diagnosis is very overwhelming, you get a crash course in cancer and you had no idea just how horrific cancer can be. But be assured, once you get your game plan on and start the fight of your life, you will feel better. I used this time to arm myself with knowledge, it kept me busy and mind from wandering. I hope you will have your family come, I pretty much did it alone and would not recommend it. It's so nice to have someone to hold you. Tell us more about your surgery, maybe on a different thread so we can give you more advice, will you have immediate reconstruction? Sleep and dream of your recovery Minka! Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Two cancers in one breast.....overwhelmed and scared.

Posts.Content: and am bringing this love train for Meena home!! So happy to hear you are doing well and your daughter's surgery went well. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Meena .. How are you doing, our PINK WARRIOR .. We are thinking about you

Posts.Content: Your works (or should I say pleasure?) looks amazing. I would definitely want you to bake me a cake LOL.. YUMMM Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Pics of my hobbies now posted on my expressions- Enjoy

Posts.Content: No more rads AND daffodils, sounds like the perfect day to me!! Wow Linda, you have come a long way, it's strange to follow each other's processes and seeing you come such a long way. And still support all of us in the process of it. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: I am a rad grad! Yipee!!

Posts.Content: I remember when I first found this board. I was anxiety ridden and desperate to find some guidance from women who went through the same experience as me. And I found that and so much more. Just reading over the entries, there's so much caring and bonding on this board that sometimes I wish I could meet you in person. I saw myself graduating over time and now I can give newbees some input. And I know I will still be checking back on this board for years to come. As I will never forget how much it meant to me during my battle. So I have been on here now 8 months. Ayse
Posts.Title: How long have you been on this board?

Posts.Content: First, welcome though I hate to see you here (: But if you have to be on a cancer board, THIS is the place to be. This is a place bustling with smart and caring women, ready to help anyway they can. I had a double mastectomy and reconstruction. My doctor put the expanders in and every week I got expanded. This was a painful process to me and I would recommend you take the valium they give you, helps with the muscle spasms. Then they put the real implants in. That was not a hard surgery for me. And now, not to ruin it for you, while I have amazing looking breasts, every doctor compliments me on them, I do find them uncomfortable and sometimes play with the thought of having them removed. But for now I saw enough doctors to last me for a life time and I am leaving it alone (: Good luck with your surgery and I hope you will have a very quick recovery. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Need to make a decision on recconstruction

Posts.Content: This is a great article in the huffington post, I wish I would have read this at the time of my diagnosis.It is spot on Article: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/jeff-tomczek/cancer-advice_b_1628266.html Enjoy, Ayse
Posts.Title: This is spot on!

Posts.Content: See now these sort of posts piss me off! Kay I am so sorry to hear this. Please please please let it be good news on tuesday... too many sisters My heart is already in a million pieces. I know you must be in a scary place in your head. Please come post And let us console you the best we can.... Love you kay ayse
Posts.Title: smalldoggroomer Update (Another update 8/12/12 & 8/13/12)

Posts.Content: Catherine, you do such a wonderful job with the birthdays. And I have a little confession to make. Around my Birthday I was heavy in the chemo fog and feeling a little low and hiding in my hole. I barely even came to check the board. But I did on my birthday to see if you had remembered and there all these posts and I was really touched. And since then I make it a point to post on the birthday wishes. You never knew how you lured me out of my hole did you? Jenny, how thoughtful of you, thanks. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: My New Pic

Posts.Content: See now these sort of posts piss me off! Kay I am so sorry to hear this. Please please please let it be good news on tuesday... too many sisters My heart is already in a million pieces. I know you must be in a scary place in your head. Please come post And let us console you the best we can.... Love you kay ayse
Posts.Title: smalldoggroomer Update (Another update 8/12/12 & 8/13/12)

Posts.Content: Lylie, from your post I get the feeling you already know what you want to do and where you want to be. Cancer if funny that way, it really makes you clean house. Put aside your emotions, as hard as it will be with all you are going through, but the last thing you want to do is make this any harder on yourself. Look at your treatment time as a time to reflect and in your case to react. Make smart moves and eliminate anything stressful, be blissfully ignorant and turn the other blind eye. Go ahead and make a blue print, a blue print of your brand new life and let that be your focus. That and your health. We are here for support and if he does come around, we are here to cheer for you - no matter what. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Unsupportive husband

Posts.Content: Please accept my heartfelt condolences about the loss of your friend. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: With a heavy heart..

Posts.Content: Laura, I was thinking about you, so good to see you! Gosh what to say other than hang in there and that I am hoping for no dialysis for you. And you may find some comfort somehow. It sounds like you are in a lot of pain. Giving you a biiiig hug! Ayse
Posts.Title: Hey checking in just got out of hospital need prayers

Posts.Content: I better get started, I making artesian finger sandwiches for everyone. Someone has to put an end to all that noshing.. LOL JUST kidding, bring on the brownies. Here we come Libby, we'll be there 10 am sharply, maybe a little earlier so we can all form a long line and give you a good luck hug! Ayse
Posts.Title: Get pet scans RESULTS in the am.... left out an important word!!!

Posts.Content: this may mean crying, feeling terrified, but understand that this is just part of the big picture that is called survival. I may be facing that decision, waiting for blood test results. And I have already made my peace with it. Of course I went through all the motions, much like yourself - cried, was scared but this is the road to acceptance. I am glad you found this. It helps me so much, I am on here pretty much every evening and I feel less alone. Sending you hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Mastectomy in 5 Days - Having a Hard Time Coming to Terms/Accepting it Emotionally

Posts.Content: and about me. I am getting a reputation around here. I am not a swinger, there, did that clear things up? (; Teehihihi Ayse
Posts.Title: Get pet scans RESULTS in the am.... left out an important word!!!

Posts.Content: I went through chemo kicking and scream (even if it was just in my imagination). Prior to cancer I never took any medication at all, strong believer in rest, nutrition and physical fitness. So it was VERY hard for me to have them pump all these chemicals in my body. But as others posted before, I was clueless on what to do. But I knew one thing, my cancer was very aggressive and the tumor grew so fast, I did not have time to experiment. Am I experimenting now? You bet I am. I didn't during chemo, did not want to interfere with it. But now I do everything I personally think would be beneficial to me. I am a big advocate for juicing and I read and learn a lot about natural ways to heal my battered body. And some times I feel like I stepped on some toes when I posted on here. But I don't want to tell anyone how to go about their healing, I am just suggesting and sharing. Our bodies went through so much that I think we need to take EXTREMELY good care of them. I get that a lot, sometimes I felt like I asked too many questions but then again this is MY life and I have a right to get as much information as I can. I feel like my oncologist is not taking my side effects seriously. And I HATE, hate hate not getting an answer... as to why I feel so exhausted. It scares me... since the year leading up to my diagnosis, I went through similar things and at time also no one knew what was wrong with me. But I am still getting my ohm on when I can and I keep walking as much as I can. There's gotta be light at the end of the tunnel.. I just know it. Sorry for rambling on. I don't handle not being able to be active very well. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: natural cure stuff

Posts.Content: am still hoping ferociously for our miracle case to show cancer who's boss. Love you Libby! Ayse
Posts.Title: Get pet scans RESULTS in the am.... left out an important word!!!

Posts.Content: I love to get good news on this board. It makes me smile cheek to cheek. Let's see how much fund, laughter and love you can cram in into another six months. Soon it will be a year, then five and so on! So better think about ways to fill all that wonderful time (: Love, Ayse
Posts.Title: Good to Go for Another Six Months

Posts.Content: it sounds to me like you need more attentive doctors and if they don't give you the attention you need, then demand it and if that doesn't work then kiss them good bye. Please don't even think of giving up. That is not the real you talking. Being constantly ill and fatigued can play tricks on your mind. It is important that you don't turn your back on yourself. Instead of thinking of giving up think how can you pamper and make yourself feel better. My friend whom I visited after so many years and found out that due to his illness (his muscles are degenerating) said something to me and it always comes back when I am having a hard day. He said life is amazing but the trick is to not waste a day. So I try my best not to waste it and somehow put a smile on my face. Stay focused on your healing and stay strong. Sending you love, Ayse
Posts.Title: I'm another one that needs to vent

Posts.Content: it sounds to me like you need more attentive doctors and if they don't give you the attention you need, then demand it and if that doesn't work then kiss them good bye. Please don't even think of giving up. That is not the real you talking. Being constantly ill and fatigued can play tricks on your mind. It is important that you don't turn your back on yourself. Instead of thinking of giving up think how can you pamper and make yourself feel better. My friend whom I visited after so many years and found out that due to his illness (his muscles are degenerating) said something to me and it always comes back when I am having a hard day. He said life is amazing but the trick is to not waste a day. So I try my best not to waste it and somehow put a smile on my face. Stay focused on your healing and stay strong. Sending you love, Ayse
Posts.Title: I'm another one that needs to vent

Posts.Content: I haven't seen you post and worry about you dearly. Your presence is missed. I miss your wit, your amazing insight and the way you somehow shed light on every dark moment. Please chime in and let me know you are doing alright and that your are still lurking in the shadows and making sure everyone is still keeping their sense of humor. Miss you dear heart! Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: A shout out to a very special lady - Chenheart

Posts.Content: For sharing, this sounds like it could be interesting! They'll advertise it as it approaches. BC is becoming more and more of a public matter with now so many more and younger women getting effected. Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Jennifer Aniston directs film

Posts.Content: Wishing you all the best to come! Ayse
Posts.Title: Today is Rague's birthday!

Posts.Content: Don't be mad at your friend, while you are correct you are the one going through it, don't forget it affects everyone around us and some just are not as strong. She should have told you and not blow up on you. But she probably didn't know how. I am delighted to read that your are pressing on and even got yourself a sidekick. It makes me smile, he must be an amazing young man to face this with you. But how could anyone resist your caring and fighting spirit? Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Time for an update!

Posts.Content: Holy smokes chemo #52... I am so happy to hear that you got to watch your daughter play softball. Here's to many more games Marsha. Sending you buncha Loove, Ayse
Posts.Title: ~Shout Out To Marsha Mulvey~

Posts.Content: by treating myself to a ballet tomorrow. Since monday, I will be very busy first thing in the morning, it's time for a lovely radioactive injection and then I get to spend 30-40 minutes in a tube ( I have to admit, usually cursing under my breath), I think they call this a PET scan (; Then off to work and after meet my mortgage counselor to chase my dream. So it's a pretty full day. Hope you will all be showered with love in the form of chocolated, flowers and Champagne in candle light!! LOTSA love to all the kindred spirits on here!! Hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: *~~~ Do You Have Any Special Plans For Valentine's Day? ~~~*

Posts.Content: My favorite.. I once begged my friend to take my leftover birthday flourless chocolate cake, as I JUST KNEW what a danger it posed in my apartment, beckoning, calling out to me.. luring me in.. YUMMM Ayse
Posts.Title: *~~~ Do You Have Any Special Plans For Valentine's Day? ~~~*

Posts.Content: you look great Donna!! One can hardly see the grey on this picture. and nice smile by the way. I love when I can put a face to the name. Mine looks very much like yours. I am afraid to color it yet as I read the posts of others who have tried but knowing me it won't be long. I am just too young for grey hair. Ayse
Posts.Title: This is me with 5 months of new hair.

Posts.Content: that you are not feeling well. It gets harder towards the end. Did you notice I said the end? Hang in there and take really good care of yourself,you are almost there. A fever can be very dangerous in your situation, please keep us updated. Hugs Ayse
Posts.Title: ughh Chemo #5 and I'm sick!

Posts.Content: Doris,   coming from you I know you must really feel lousy, you are a VERY tough cookie.  I wish I had some great advice but all I can add is, I drank ginger tea for my nausea and it really helped. Also Trader Joe's sells ginger gummies, they are great too.  Hope you feel better.   Gentle hugs, Ayse
Posts.Title: Need what?
